evidence: So, the Fourier transform of the blurred image equals the product of the transforms of the original image and the PSF.
triples.o: product of the transforms of the original image and the PSF
triples.s: Fourier transform of the blurred image

evidence: This slide shows how inverse filtering works in the frequency domain.
In the Fourier domain, convolution becomes multiplication.
To reverse this, we perform division in the frequency domain - this is the essence of inverse filtering.
Applying the inverse Fourier transform brings us back to the spatial domain.
This process forms the basis of many image restoration techniques.
In the Fourier domain, convolution becomes multiplication.
